Sun.title: July full moon 2025 rises this week: Here's what to expect from the 'Buck Moon'
Sun.description: July’s full 'Buck Moon' rises close to aphelion, making it the furthest full moon from the sun in 2025.
Sun.author: Anthony Wood

Sun.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Sun.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Sun.author: Anthony Wood

Sun.title: Scientists capture never-before-seen plasma streams and bizarre 'raindrops' in sharpest-ever view of sun's outer atmosphere (video)
Sun.description: Using a newly developed adaptive optics system called Cona, scientists peered through Earth's turbulent air to reveal the sun's corona in astonishing clarity.
Sun.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Mercury.title: February new moon 2025: The young moon occults Mercury and passes by Venus
Mercury.description: On Feb. 28, the one-day-old moon will pass in front of Mercury for observers in Australia and the south Pacific, and on March 1 the moon will make a close pass to Venus.
Mercury.author: Jesse Emspak

Mercury.title: See Mercury at its best in the night sky over the next 2 weeks
Mercury.description: Despite its reputation, Mercury is not really that difficult to spot. But March 2025
Mercury.author: Joe Rao

Venus.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Venus.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Venus.author: Anthony Wood

Venus.title: Venus, Saturn and the moon dazzle at dawn in 'romantic' photo from Chew Valley Lake (photo)
Venus.description: It was a race against the rising sun as astrophotographer Josh Dury captured a fleeting cosmic moment before dawn’s light washed the scene away.
Venus.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Venus.title: Curious circles on Venus suggest its surface is still changing
Venus.description: Out of 75 coronae examined, 52 showed signs of these underground forces still at work, hinting that tectonic activity may be more widespread on Venus than previously thought.
Venus.author: Victoria Corless

Earth.title: The ocean on Saturn's icy moon Enceladus has the right pH for life — barely
Earth.description: "We know that some microbes on Earth can tolerate the range of pH found on Enceladus."
Earth.author: Keith Cooper

Earth.title: Intelligent aliens could be drawn to Earth by 'leaking' airports
Earth.description: "Our work supports both the scientific quest to answer the question 'Are we alone?' and practical efforts to manage the influence of technology on our world and beyond."
Earth.author: Robert Lea

Earth.title: How long would it take Superman to travel from Krypton to Earth?
Earth.description: Travelling 42 light-years is no joke, even when you're faster than a speeding bullet!
Earth.author: Robert Lea

Mars.title: Could NASA's Mars Sample Return be saved? Lockheed Martin proposes $3 billion plan to haul home Red Planet rocks (video)
Mars.description: The aerospace giant says it can revive Mars Sample Return with a leaner, lower-cost approach drawing on proven designs.
Mars.author: Andrew Jones

Mars.title: NASA teaches Mars orbiter to roll over in quest to find Red Planet water
Mars.description: The spacecraft now almost tips upside down relative to Mars to give its radar the best view.
Mars.author: Keith Cooper

Mars.title: Don't miss the crescent moon shining close to Mars on May 31
Mars.description: As the bright star Regulus and the Beehive Cluster shine close by.
Mars.author: Anthony Wood

Jupiter.title: Trump's 2026 budget would slash NASA funding by 24% and its workforce by nearly one third
Jupiter.description: A number of high-profile missions would get the axe, including the New Horizons Pluto probe and Juno Jupiter orbiter.
Jupiter.author: Mike Wall

Jupiter.title: See Jupiter pair up with a sliver of the moon tonight
Jupiter.description: The King of the Planets teams up with an exceedingly narrow crescent moon for the last time this year in the evening sky on May 27.
Jupiter.author: Joe Rao

Jupiter.title: New moon of May 2025 leaves the night sky dark to see the summer constellations tonight
Jupiter.description: Two days after its new phase, the moon will make a close pass to Jupiter in the evening sky while the summer constellations will be rising.
Jupiter.author: Jesse Emspak

Saturn.title: The ocean on Saturn's icy moon Enceladus has the right pH for life — barely
Saturn.description: "We know that some microbes on Earth can tolerate the range of pH found on Enceladus."
Saturn.author: Keith Cooper

Saturn.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.

Saturn.description: It was a race against the rising sun as astrophotographer Josh Dury captured a fleeting cosmic moment before dawn’s light washed the scene away.
Saturn.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Neptune.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
